title: A New Battery That Uses Calcium Instead of Lithium
summary: Scientists in Hong Kong have made an exciting new battery that uses calcium instead of lithium. Calcium is a common element found in things like chalk and milk, so it's easier to get than lithium. This new battery is called a calcium-ion battery. It can store energy from sources like solar and wind power, and it might be used in electric cars one day. The scientists used special materials called quasi-solid-state electrolytes to help the calcium ions move better inside the battery. This makes the battery work well for over 1,000 times of charging and discharging. It's a big step toward making batteries that are better for the environment and can help us use more clean energy.

background_read: Batteries are important for storing energy from renewable sources like the sun and wind. Lithium-ion batteries are common but use lithium, which is limited. Calcium is more abundant and could make batteries more sustainable. This article explains how scientists created a new calcium-ion battery that works well and could help the environment.
